channel.title: Blocking Invalid/Offensive Usernames
channel.description:
I need help. I have created this:
[code] if(playerName.contains("~") || playerName.contains("!") || playerName.contains("@") || playerName.contains("#") || playerName.contains("$") || playerName.contains("%") || playerName.contains("^") || playerName.contains("&") || playerName.contains("*") || playerName.contains("=") || playerName.contains("+") || playerName.contains(".") || playerName.contains("/") || playerName.contains(",") || playerName.contains("?") || playerName.contains(">") || playerName.contains("<") || playerName.contains("}") || playerName.contains("{") || playerName.contains("]") || playerName.contains("[") || playerName.contains("-") || playerName.contains("__") || playerName.contains("_") || playerName.contains("___") || playerName.contains("____") || playerName.contains("_____") || playerName.contains("admin") || playerName.contains("SYI") || playerName.contains("SYIpkpker") || playerName.contains("null") || playerName.contains("fuck") || playerName.contains("bitch") || playerName.contains("cunt") || playerName.contains("dick") || playerName.contains("cock") || playerName.contains("penis") || playerName.contains("vagina") || playerName.contains("dildo") || playerName.contains("shit") || playerName.contains("ass") || playerName.contains("nigger") || playerName.contains("pussy") || playerName.contains("faggot") || playerName.contains("fagget") || playerName.contains("faggit") || playerName.contains("fuk") || playerName.contains("whore")) { returnCode = 4; }[/code]
The returnCode = 4; is supposed to tell the person their account has been disabled, yet it still lets them log in. What am I doing wrong? I used to have: [code] disconnected = true; savefile = false; appendToBanned(playerName);[/code] But that would log them in, disconnect, and ban them but I don't want them to login period... I want it to automatically display the banned message. I added this under my process() (Don't tell me that makes it lag because I don't care, and it doesn't even lag for me) Help?

item.title: Blocking Invalid/Offensive Usernames
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I need help. I have created this:

if(playerName.contains("~") || playerName.contains("!") || playerName.contains("@") || playerName.contains("#") || playerName.contains("$") || playerName.contains("%") || playerName.contains("^") || playerName.contains("&") || playerName.contains("*") || playerName.contains("=") || playerName.contains("+") || playerName.contains(".") || playerName.contains("/") || playerName.contains(",") || playerName.contains("?") || playerName.contains(">") || playerName.contains("<") || playerName.contains("}") || playerName.contains("{") || playerName.contains("]") || playerName.contains("[") || playerName.contains("-") || playerName.contains("__") || playerName.contains("_") || playerName.contains("___") || playerName.contains("____") || playerName.contains("_____") || playerName.contains("admin") || playerName.contains("SYI") || playerName.contains("SYIpkpker") || playerName.contains("null") || playerName.contains("fuck") || playerName.contains("bitch") || playerName.contains("cunt") || playerName.contains("dick") || playerName.contains("cock") || playerName.contains("penis") || playerName.contains("vagina") || playerName.contains("dildo") || playerName.contains("shit") || playerName.contains("ass") || playerName.contains("nigger") || playerName.contains("pussy") || playerName.contains("faggot") || playerName.contains("fagget") || playerName.contains("faggit") || playerName.contains("fuk") || playerName.contains("whore")) { returnCode = 4; }

The returnCode = 4; is supposed to tell the person their account has been disabled, yet it still lets them log in. What am I doing wrong? I used to have:

disconnected = true; savefile = false; appendToBanned(playerName);
But that would log them in, disconnect, and ban them but I don’t want them to login period… I want it to automatically display the banned message. I added this under my process() (Don’t tell me that makes it lag because I don’t care, and it doesn’t even lag for me) Help?

Read full topic
